Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	This begins the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh children, know that I have given you this book as a gift, the last of the art of medicine, for its completion serves your health, and through its explanations, and through its declarations, it is clear to me how I have completed that which I promised in this treatise. This work is part of my surgical practice.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation on a human being is relegated to our region and in our time, almost entirely private, where its science endures great risk, and its traces are left behind; it would not have survived without some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which corrected many errors and misunderstandings about it. The interpretations of these were often closed off and the effort required to understand them was extended.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I should revive the order of this treatise according to the way of exposition, declaration, and abbreviation; and for bringing it to conform with the forms of the tools of cauterization and other work instruments, as well as for adding the declaration, and preparing it, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why no skilled artisan exists in their own hand in this our time is that the art of medicine is long and requires being exercised in front of knowledge in the science of anatomy, as Guali knew about the youth of body parts and their forms, as well as their connection and separation; he had knowledge of bones, nerves, and muscles, including their number and structure. He was aware of pulsatile veins and quiet ones, and the sites for their discharge.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And that's why Hippocrates said in his book, mostly in the art of the hand, that skill is everything.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	May we have already mentioned this in the introduction of this book; whoever does not know what we have said about anatomy cannot avoid falling into error, which will lead to the death of people. I have seen too many cases like this, where some are formed in this science and abandon their own field of study and experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	And I have seen a surgeon skilled and experienced who has caused an erysipelas to occur on the neck of a woman, and by incising some neck arteries that there was a large hemorrhage resulting in her death during one of his operations.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I have seen another surgeon who was about to remove a hernia from an old man whose condition had deteriorated, the hernia being large. It moved towards him and removed that hernia with a piece of the bladder. As a result, that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have already attempted to remove that, and I saw that due to the size of the hernia and the position of the patient under him, he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I have seen another surgeon who was taking pay from the Duke of our land for surgery, and operated on a black captain who had been hit by his horse; he took advantage of the surgeon's ignorance to remove the fracture, covering the wound with bandages and splints made of strong material, and did not allow air into the wound.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he would slip according to his desires, and afterward he would dress the wound, and then allowed it to heal over several days as commanded by our prescriptions; this also happens when the skin and chest are erysipelas infected, leading to disaster.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I have attempted this for him, and helped to slip out the obstruction, achieving tranquility and alleviation of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, the corruption was already confirmed in the limb, so I couldn't restrain it, and it continued to spread the corruption within the body as the patient's condition deteriorated.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I have seen another surgeon who drilled an abscess and was ulcerated several days later, during which his illness increased in the lord's presence.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	This is the reason why the wet nurse must be pure of melancholy humor; otherwise, it would affect him with all its strength, but rather that there is a member that suffers from everything being affected by it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for that reason, children, it is necessary for you to have the operation on a person divided into two parts: one associated with health and in work where danger is present in major circumstances.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already set out this in all parts of this book where there is operation involving error and fear; it is necessary for you to keep that in mind so that the pages do not accuse you and mislead you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And so take your weapons in the service of God and protection, and your patients with happiness and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way with God's grace to obtain health and reasonable succession, and tolerate the terrible diseases that are difficult to heal, and keep your weapons away from what you fear, so that recovery is in your faith and in your name does not abandon you: for more remain at your glory, and also in this world and later on your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Guali already said in some of his monochords:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Don't treat bad patients with bad medicine, for it is not the fault of doctors that they are named badly."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have completed this book according to three main points.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins, and first comes the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered within the feet, in the forms of the tools and in the implements of the cautery, and what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, concerning drying and puncturing, as well as the use of blisters, plagues, extraction of arrows, and resemblance to those, all organized and detailed in the forms of the tools.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, concerning restoration and dislocation, as well as the treatment of torsion and resemblance to those. The chapter is organized within foot ailments, detailing in the forms of the tools.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	About the cautery with fire and the use of acute medicine, remembering the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	And with this begins the discussion on all the free topics.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Let me tell you about the quality of those cauteries and their lumps, and in which phase it is prohibited to use a cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	So I say that the discourse on the quality of the cautery's lump and its lump is long and tedious, subtle in knowledge, and hidden in secrecy; already many wise people have spoken about it in detail, and they disagree among themselves, yet I am content with a small part of their discourses, fearing lengthiness.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And I say that the cautery confirms to any phase universally made of matter or sex matter, except for two phases; those are phases made of sex matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the phase of dryness and heat, there is matter; some argue that the cautery should be applied to such conditions, while others say the opposite. They believe it's not convenient for an illness characterized by its nature and dryness, as fire has these qualities. It's inconvenient for a caudal and dry ailment when treated with something hot and dry which might heal it instead of being detrimental.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And the one who disagrees with this argues that in all dry and hot ailments that occur within human bodies, when you compare the body of a person to the phase of fire, you find that the human body is cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say according to the discourse of this, which I have experimented with for several times and discovered.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, I do not delve into what has already been extensively discussed in the chapter on cautery and known through later exercises. I understand the variety of human phases and the distribution of illnesses among their members, as well as the causes of those illnesses and the occurrences related to them, and the timing for those events.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other phases, do not worry about this, especially with wet and humid illnesses; already all doctors have agreed on these, there is no disagreement. And they are not concerned with the use of cautery in wet conditions.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that in the secret of healing with fire and the goodness of this matter, concerning cautery using medicine, it is because fire is simple; its action only reaches the part that is treated by cautery and does not extend to other parts unless there's a slight injury.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of medicine used for burning reaches those parts of the body where it was applied, and it significantly increases the difficulty in healing an illness in that body part, making recovery quite hard.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	The fire, by its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not do anything except excess. We have known this through experiments and long years of service studying the art, understanding the truth about their causes; thus I justify myself for the length of my discourse. If it were not that my freedom in writing this passage did not allow me to reveal this secret related to fire, as well as the quality of its operation within bodies and its expulsion, which would serve as a philosophical demonstration revealing itself in your minds, it would be enlightening for you.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree on the time when it is convenient to apply cautery and wait for the best springtime period.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is convenient at any time because the injury caused by time's passage is submerged in the heat of what was applied with the cautery, especially if it's for pain or necessary pains, strong ones and pimples which do not suffer from delay as they are feared compared to those that might cause malice, which is more significant than a small injury coming over time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this does not pass in your minds, or, children, they only consider what the common people and ordinary folk doctors think, that is, it's not necessary to apply cautery at all times when healing from an illness; thus there is a consequence with that.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not as simple as they think; cautery is merely a form of medicine that alters phase and dries out the humidity which causes pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	And indeed, unnecessary cautery over medicine due to the value and virtue of its operation and the greatness of its master.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it's possible that the patient's illness could return at any time depending on the phase of their illness and the location of their ailment, its virtue, what is prepared within their body from accumulating superfluities, as well as what is ingested in foods related to those causes; unless the illness being treated with cautery is a subtle illness involving few superfluities and humidity. For instance, when dental cautery is done for pain, it's possible that this type of pain doesn't return within them anymore, though this happens in smaller cases.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	A common medical term is that the cautery is the last resort of medicine, and this is a professional discourse, not one I understand in it, they say that using it does not constitute treatment nor another cause leading to cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The cause is against this; and I understand that the cautery is the last resort of medicine not simply when administering the methods of treatment for some illnesses, and those medicines do not work, and at the end of the cause one applies cautery, and proceeds with that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here comes the view that the cautery is the last resort of medicine, not according to my understanding, which agrees with common knowledge and many doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients would say that a cautery made of gold is better than one made of iron, and they would not say this simply because of the equality in terms of value between gold and the inferiority of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they say that the location for applying the cautery does not cause a burn, as this is not absolutely true; I have already experimented with this and found out that it doesn't do this unless in certain parts of the body, where a gold cautery is good and better than an iron one just like they would say. Yet however, when you apply the cautery using fire onto metal, you are not told to do this, as the heat depends on the quantity you want based on the size of the gold, and how it needs to be received in preparation; and if you adjust over the flame, the gold melts with the fire; and in case of burning in the fire, a few sheets are produced for the artisan to work upon that part.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And because of this, when applying the iron cautery, you should do so more gently and more precisely according to the principles of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already organized this chapter concerning the cautery according to sections, and I have organized those of the section within the feet, because I will ask you for what you want from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Regarding the application of a cautery for head pain caused by coldness and dampness.
Le capitol primier.	The first section.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This application of cautery brings about the effect of humidity and coldness onto a specific part of the body where two causes are involved, causing swelling, inflammation, and traumatic flow, known as "corissa," from the head to other parts of the neck and ear fluid, along with various sleep issues, tooth pain, throat problems, and universally for all illnesses caused by coldness, whether they are paralytic, swollen, or resulting in stroke, and similar conditions.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cautery is like this, initially instruct the patient to undergo a medicine-based elimination of toxins from their head for three or four nights, according to what you require and the patient's health condition and routine.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And subsequently command the patient to clean their head with a razor and then make them lie down on a sloped bench, placing their hands under their back.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And place the palm of your hand next to the nose's edge between their ears.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when you have determined the right location as advised by you, mark that spot with your finger and then apply an olive oil cautery of this form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place it over the marked spot on your heated hand in such a way that as you descend, your hand is gradually constrained, and you rotate that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand gently and look at the spot, and if you see some amount of skull being exposed already, like the quantity of fat that sticks out, in this case, lift your hand, and if it doesn't heat up with iron or another type when placed on it, especially if it's cold, then you will observe the condition I have told you about.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt and dissolve it on that spot, and let that sit for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place an unripe buttercote over it and let that sit until the layer of burnt skin is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And subsequently, cure the area with tetrarhompha cream until it heals.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they have said that whenever the wound is opened like this, it's much better and quicker to heal compared to when it isn't, because it heals faster and rejuvenates more.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they say that when the canal is burnt into the bone, and then letting the cautery remain until it adheres to some part of the bone's surface.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then scrape off this burnt bone piece, and then let it heal.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And they say that when the cautery reaches the deepest point, it strengthens the bone inside until the bone breaks through, and this is how you perform this treatment:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They estimate that from that place, vapor from the head escapes.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And let the wound remain open for a long time, and then it will be healed once it has been consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	Nowadays I do not see these two kinds of head cauteries at all, but in some individuals according to fear; let this stand: it's better for health when done immediately, as the head is healed through the continuity of its own juices as we've witnessed in other body parts, and especially so when the head is made of fatty nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the type of cautery first is more saving and better you must use it; and from that one, do that work until it is healed.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	On the head's cautery.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and long-lasting head pain occurs throughout the whole body, and this lasts in the patient for a long time, using remedies like herbs, spices, poultices, oils, combs, scissors, gauze, and bandages, especially if an earlier cautery has been used which didn't alleviate the effects of those causes; then consider that if the head is strong by nature; and doesn't undergo severe pain or fever, then this cautery uses another kind, letting the previous one use a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And place that cautery on the top of their head, within which the pain is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the pain and reveal its quantity from the opening of the mouth, which we have measured, and place that on a cautery in the part behind the head at the location which is called the vessel - and this is the location where suction is made.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And warm your hand in ashes, and do not reveal the mouth, for when this is done, the patient experiences various intense pain different from the pain of all other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I shall say this about the cautery in its place, that when one uses a cautery to cauterize the heads and occiputs of the head is more subtle than the one used which cauterizes the middle of the head; and this is how it should be done.

De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the treatment for new migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When the pain is concentrated in the head or occurs inside the skull, it should be treated with medicines that soothe headaches and then administer another cure which I have described in treatments for illnesses; if none of these methods work, then the cautery treatment for this would be done in two ways: either using an acute burning medicine as a cautery, or using iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	A cautery made with a burning medicine is that you take half a clove of garlic, crush it and cut off the ends from both heads.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then prick the pain spot on the temple with a pointed needle inside where you make the incision, inside where the pain is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then strengthen yourself by stopping any descent of congestion, let that flow through spaces of three hours; and gently remove the garlic, leave the wound for two or three days, and rest on your elbow with it submerged in water until the place becomes warm.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with ointment once it has healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you see fit, do this with some burning medicines that I have written about in the detailed treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	A cautery made with iron follows this way: heat it up to use as a cautery, in the following manner:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	And it is called a thorn lock, where the head of the patient resembles a thorn in which there is some curvature, and at the middle of the head is a small elevation.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And place your hand over the location of pain, and hold it back - so that you do not burn the skin which is under this - and slowly rotate the small iron piece with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of it that is burned by the sensitivity of the pain is as much as half of this, lift your hand in such a way that the artery which under this is not burned either, so that no blood flow occurs.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then soak your elbow in salt water and place it over the area, let this rest for three days; and then rest with a damp cloth on the water, and then cure with ointment once it has healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see fit, cauterize at the end of the bistoury (surgical knife) as per cautery instructions, and watch that you do not make an incision into the artery in this new migraine.

De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the treatment for old migraines.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os. Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme. And if it is about the care and caution of blood flow from the artery that is cut, there is fear in this dissection, especially for those who do not understand what they are doing and lack experience; and leave the operation as planned.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I shall return to recall the regulation of blood flow from an artery accident according to its manner, in this section of this work.

De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the treatment of curvature through cautery.

And the method of cautery is that you apply it at the tip of the opening of the ear much higher than a little above the corn of the head, and on its skin edge another, whose length should be according to the length of that particular spot, and then pause your hand with the cautery until that quantity of the substance of the disease in the tendon is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is how the cautery works, it's an art of surgery, the form of which is demonstrated in front of the table.

E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with what's in front during the process until it heals.

De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Regarding the treatment of nasal odor.

When you are treating that with what we have described in the division and it doesn't improve your treatment, then prepare and give three nights of garlic to the patient; and then shave the head of the patient, and apply a medium olive cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then apply a rosemary cautery with two small cauterizations on each eyebrow, leaving just a little hair.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that area.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And make the point of the cautery, this is its method.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Regarding the cautery for the blanching and smoothing of the eyelids of rabbits.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the rabbit is inflamed or due to disease or moisture, then apply a cautery over that eyelid with this lunar cautery; and this is how you do it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you are doing it, apply the cautery over both eyebrows for a little bit with two cauteries across its entirety, and let them extend to the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery according to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand too much against the cautery, but according to how much of the eyelid's curved part becomes heated.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Regarding the cautery for the eyelid of the rabbit when the skin has turned into parts inside and extends to the belly of the rabbit.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the rabbit turns into parts inside such that it touches the belly, apply a cautery to those in two ways: either use an ordinary cautery or one with medicinal properties.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you use a rabbit cautery with fire, command the patient to show their skin like those that are shaved, within which they should be extended and equalized; and if you hold onto that, then grasp the rabbit's skin with one hand so that it does not get burned until the hair grows out from under the skin.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they are extended and equalized, then place the head of the patient in your own hand, and place over the eyelids of the rabbit with a sign indicating it like the figure of a fern leaf, and make the start of the sign close to the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then place a small amount of rabbit's albumen or pus from a boil on the belly.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And apply the heat of the cautery, which is how you do it for this.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And gradually apply the heat of the cautery over the sign which you've made, little by little in patches until it burns the surface of the skin like a fern leaf, entirely resembling that.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And as a sign of healing for the patient's work, you should see that the eyelid of the rabbit is now pulled back and its hair is raised above the needle's puncture.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And raise your hand and leave that for three days, then place over it a small amount of butter until the scab is fully formed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And treat that with ointment until it heals.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	And if there is any cause that returns to their location and the eyelid becomes inflamed again, then do another round of cautery over that area just as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	And if the skin is still present on the eyelid, then apply a cautery until it returns to its natural place and becomes equalized so that the hair does not touch the belly.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And the cautery with medicinal properties is this: command the patient to show their skin until it is extended and equalized, then have it done in the shape of a fern leaf from a piece of cloth.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take some well-known soap and a living onion root. .1., Mix that and let it cook until it doesn't cool down; then spread that over the cloth which was made in this shape like a fern leaf, place that on one or both rabbits; and place the rabbit's head in your own hand.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the described above over the medicine and press it a little bit but don't burn the patient with it, which burning sensation should be like that of fire in them.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when you notice the burning sensation, then remove the medicine and place it in your designated hand; once that burning sensation stops, then rinse the medicine off on their belly with water; then consider if the eyelid has lifted as if it is washed of by fire or incision, which happens immediately afterwards; and if it doesn't return to that area of the medicine over the spot where the medicine was not applied and does not touch until your operation is fully equalized and the rabbit's hair is pulled back.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And place over it a small amount of butter or another substance until it heals, ensuring that the scab associated with itching is eradicated and then treat it with an ointment or something else until it has healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And for this to be necessary, you must keep vigilant care with your operation so that the medicine doesn't fall off in the rabbit's belly; if the eyelid becomes soft after some days and any cause of hair touching it, then apply your medicine over that area which is made soft by the eyelid, precisely as you did at first, and place the patient until they are healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is how a fern leaf looks.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	Know that humans' rabbits vary according to size and thickness, so your operation depends on this.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And let there be no concealment of the path to rectitude towards that which is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Regarding the surgical treatment of a fistula that occurs in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula, remember what we've discussed in the division of illnesses and do not proceed with your treatment. Instead, follow this method for cautery: instruct the patient to hold their head on your side, and place another servant's hand between your hands as if to support them without disturbing or agitating them under their head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then hold the point close in the white part of the eye or on the mucous membrane above the patient's tear duct.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And now heat up the cautery tool like this:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	Which should be rounded, such as in the shape of a cane or a bird's quill feather, with one end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you can see, it should penetrate to the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if desired, it should be removed in such a way as to avoid damage.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, whoever is rounder tends better towards your task.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And if the fistula has opened, press it gently and help the patient obtain relief and dry out that area.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it hasn't opened, then open it and remove the pus from the patient.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place on the patient's eye the heated cautery, and hold your hand near but not quite at the tear duct to the nasal passage, so that your hand doesn't disturb the patient or make them anxious. Then pause the cautery in the gray area of the eye and proceed with this task.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of your cautery it enters the nostril, it's good; otherwise, then you should apply the cautery once or twice as needed and leave it like that for three days. Then place this point with a border on the eye area and insert some dried grease inside until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	And if it has passed ten days and is not healed, then place on the corrosive quick medicine inside that the nostril be exposed and shave according to what suits in its forehead.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And this is another method for cautery of a fistula which some earlier practitioners said: find the location of the fistula and perform it there, then pause above that fissure with a fine sliver, resembling its form. Place in that area an amount the size of one nail of melted lead; hold your hand over it with good pressure, making sure not to disturb the patient so that the melted lead does not enter their tear ducts; and when you pause on the patient's eye with heat like a point in a white part or water, let the lead melt at the site of the fistula and heal it through wonderful treatment.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed as we've discussed with cautery and treatment, it's good; otherwise, then it's necessary to administer nostril extraction and reduce the fistula to within the nasal passage according to where it naturally occurs.

De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Regarding the cautery of a cut under the foot.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Wounds often result in cuts on the lips, and more so on the lips of children.

Capitol .xix.	Capitol XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Regarding the cautery of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the tonsil area or on the palate or in the area of the teeth where pus occurs, you make a cut and then it breaks open, heals over time, and forms a fistula. When this happens, treat that instead of continuing treatment, so follow that method for using the cautery according to the amount received in the fistula, place that ignited point into the outlet of the fistula, hold your hand inside until the heat of the fire reaches its edge, do this once or twice afterward; then treat it as we have discussed regarding treatment until it heals.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the healing has been removed and it heals, it's good; otherwise, then it is necessary to uncover the place and preserve the bone according to what suits its capital.
Capitol .xx.	Capitol XX.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Regarding tooth cautery and soothing of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and teeth are tender, if you treat those with medicines instead of proceeding, then place the patient's head on your side, heat up the cautery in such a way that it is inserted soon, pause the small part over each tooth, insert the heated cautery quickly, hold your hand near so that the heat from the fire reaches the edge of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then raise your hand, and proceed to apply the cautery several times according to your wish.

Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the treatment of dental pain through cautery.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc. Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery on the gum involves taking cow's gums and boiling them in iron pots. Next, take a small piece and cover it at the tip of the tool, then immerse that into hot water, holding it over the painful tooth until it gets cooled down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeatedly apply this several times so that the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.

Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, when applying cautery with fire, you must wait for the steam of herbs or iron to occur and there should be some heat in the patient's body that does not reach into the mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia. De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the treatment of tickling that is at the head of the spine.

Then ensure that the patient turns their head onto their two hands or onto their sides; and raise the neck which is at the part inside of tickling to the parts above your left hand fingers, if the joint is dislocated inside.

E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then apply a cautery between that which goes into the other side; and the image of the cautery treatment will come this way from four points of the cautery.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And that subtle one according to the amount of heat; and this is its form:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And certain treatments are adjusted according to this count, and these are the cautery methods. VIII.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And place on the cautery with salt points, and then fasten the patient in bed, and let the limb not be burned for some time until it is comfortable.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is above and the cause is from the heat, do this, then apply a cautery on the muscle over the cauterizing point or with moisture points. Where the joint is confirmed and the dampness is eliminated and the patient is cured.

De cauterizacio del stomac.	On cautery for the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura. E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery is the quantity of the two thirds of the thickness of the intestines.

And have the stomach cautery made where that which is scared by this cautery is: and you place points on the stomach according to your desire with heat, and then apply the cautery on those points; and treat that with a cure that comes before until it heals.

De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	On cautery for the rectum fissure.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When there is pain in the rectum due to coldness or moisture or excess wind causing it to exceed its normal composition, and if the patient is treated with what we have said without confirming, then let it be that the patient is bent over their hips, and you apply three cauterizations according to this form; and this half of the quantity on either side of the rectum between the inguinal creases, until lying on one's back.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space between each cautery be according to the size of a finger; and have the cauterizations according to the length of the body straight.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not confuse your understanding with the movement of the cautery.

And remember not to overdo the cautery process, ensure that the heat is applied to all of the intestines so it reaches throughout the body and penetrates into the organs where the intestines are delicate; know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On puncturing an abscess in the rectum with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there is irritation or an abscess in the rectum and you want to know if that abscess is within the flesh of the rectum or on its covering, then if it's within the flesh of the rectum, the patient becomes weakened and pain intensifies.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it's on the covering of the rectum, with the pain is greatly intensified and often exhausts doctors in treating him.

E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And do not use this way of cautery but only that which is prolonged in the study of medical art and has known many maladies with it; rather, try some treatments on this operation, however follow my advice here and it will be better.

De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On cautery for boils.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit. Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On the treatment of removing pus through cautery.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit. E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then remove the cautery; and thus four cauterizations are done.

Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXI.
