Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	However, if the motion of that remains and any gravity occurs, then apply that with warm water and some friction several times until it is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the treatment of dislocation of fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Several times you should dislocate the fingers in every direction.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when one finger is dislocated towards the back of the palm or inside it, then hold the finger and push the dislocation with your thumbs, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the tip of the finger, hang it from the part where it is dislocated, and leave it alone for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then hang that outwards until its rightness is equal to that day's position.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it begins to heal in the night, lie that according to that narrative, and do not stop exercising that during the day and with movements, and lie that at night; and do this for a few days until it is straightened.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And pretend to do this even if it's dislocated in the chest of the hand, and lie that towards that side and perform your first operation on this, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do this when it's dislocated in other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the treatment of dislocation of the shoulders.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When it happens with any of the shoulder blades or collarbone causing full dislocation, and if there's a lot of pain in those places, then there's no cure for this, because death is feared by the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And the sign of this is that the patient's body discharge comes out forcefully against their will and they can't hold it back. Several times you should soften some limbs or both knees or their arms, or one of those; or if mass friction is applied to one shoulder blade in its place, then with mass friction, it causes moving these four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	And once it's moved back to the parts behind, it is named galebozia.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	The treatment of this is that you then need to consider if galebozia occurs during childhood, in which case there's no cure nor healing for it.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	And in those that come through injury or impact or similar to those, the Ancients would say that their treatment methods are lengthy and exhaustive; however, I have shortened it from the one you often justify with too much of this, because of my close proximity to your understanding explanation, which is what I've elaborated and organized using various tools for which I show this and explain this.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And they say that in galebozia occurring from the part behind in the legs, it's not good nor is there healing for this; similarly with the one made on both sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those, it is cured only that which happens in the feet properly among what I recommend.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And have the patient lie on their face with the back close to a wall, and stretch them out further below their feet in such a way that not even the toes touch.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And have a straight stick placed, fixed in the ground at the end of the foot near the head, and another stick opposite their feet at the other end of the body.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	The minister holds the stick, not to be fixed in a hole; and another minister holds the other according to that manner.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And wrap over the head of the patient and tie the lion's girth firmly around it; extend the end of the girth to the stick, which should be at the head of them, and secure that on them; and strengthen the other girth around their buttocks and the heels of them, aiming for their chests; and adjust all the girdles and tie those onto the other stick which aims at their feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And the minister extends the girth to the juncture of the stick, and do not let the two sticks or the girdles on their body areas where they are fixed touch each other entirely, rather, it should not be as tight as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor places his hands on the vertebra with strength between which it returns, or places one hand on that surface, and adjust their feet to return under that table.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	May if it does not return in this way, then take a table whose height or length is approximately three braccia away from the wall which we said is near the patient's body at the end of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And place the table under the vertebra, and the doctor stands on the other end; he strengthens his feet in such a way that the vertebra is tightened and returns to its place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want, open both sides that are twisted around the hand; and it is that you place in the ground the head of the patient at the end of each stick on the buttocks, where the length of each stick is a braccia. And place the head of them similarly under two sticks on the buttocks; and let the length be between any stick one palm's length. It has already been done so that each pull is made in such a way within each stick turning around it, and each is firmly placed in the ground so that they are not disturbed.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And make a stick on which the turn is made, and it should twist in both turns of the two sticks.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of which is a turn on which a stick is formed, the length of which is one hand's length where it twists; and in the other two sticks there are similar ones.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then strengthen the girdles that you have tightened around the feet of the patient on the turn which should be at their head, and tighten the girdles that you have tightened around their thighs in the turn which should be under their feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And you must have each turn with one minister who twists the turn around their hand, and the doctor matches the vertebra according to what we said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is how the turn should be done:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And this is how the process goes once the vertebra has returned and the location matched: take a tallow wax poultice and stop it; then place it on the poultice until you have a table whose width can be three inches or about those, and its length covers the area of the fat, over the juncture of the vertebra.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And after that, use the poultice as we said, and let the patient eat fine nourishment until they are healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there is any lingering discomfort in the area at the end of healing, then it should be administered with medicines that soften and clean until long after the table has been used, which we have recommended; and already lead sheet is being administered in that location.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And some inflammations may occur at the end of the vertebral columns on both sides, and it gets caught with that dislocation; and that's the place which already inflamed so that you shouldn't suspect anything to happen to him from this medicine, which will cause his death to occur.
Capitol .xxxi.	Capítulo xxxi.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that only a dislocation occurs at the junction of the thigh bone and the muscle joint, not to those what happens in other joints with minor movement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the junction of the thigh is dislocated in four ways: it can be dislocated towards the inside parts, or towards the outside parts, or towards the front parts, or towards the back parts.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And it is mostly dislocated to the inside parts, and little to the front or back parts.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	A sign of the dislocation towards the inside parts is this: when you adjust the healthy buttock against the patient's buttocks, it becomes longer and the heel becomes more prominent than on the healthy side; the patient cannot bend their foot up to their leg, so they must bend them backwards. This is where you place a cautery stick at the edge of the sticking point, because the top of the thigh bone has already penetrated here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The sign for the one where dislocation occurs is towards the outside parts; it's that Lu's accidents are against this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And as for the person to whom you have caused dislocation in their joints, it is a sign that their intestine expands according to its capacity, however, it does not double the pain that was there before. If this continues and cannot proceed beyond the affected area; their urine is retained, they are prevented from swelling, and you should walk around them on the talus.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And as for the person to whom you have caused dislocation at their back parts, it is a sign that they do not expand this area anymore, nor can they double up against what doubles their swelling. Their intestine is shorter than the other one's, and their swelling is relieved, the tip of the thigh is where you should address this issue.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	A possible reduction of this dislocation is what you should consider. If the dislocation is old and long-standing, then, when addressing your patient for treatment, you may proceed with reducing their condition according to their situation, not considering it as a complete cure; therefore, there's no need to think that in this treatment alone, everything will be fixed.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	For the one where dislocation is recent and belongs to one of the four types of dislocation, then you should guide your effort towards reversing the joint and extending it both internally and externally. Move it to the right and left sides where it returns to its normal position without needing any other treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	If it doesn't return in this manner, then you should prepare to apply force and extend the patient's intestine from its side or over their chest, or directly on where it is protruding; another should spread their hand above this so that their fingers come into contact with them. And reinforce by pressing tightly at the junction of the thigh, while having another hold onto the extremity of the ligament firmly and steadily.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And whether it is an extension of the patient or of the internal part towards the swelling on the sternum partition, or of the back part to the partition at the second rib.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And when all these extensions are done in one go, so that the patient is lifted up to their earth-based body height and hangs down.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this type of extension is common for all four kinds.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And so if the dislocation returns as we have said, it's good; and otherwise, then for every kind of treatment that you should consider on your own.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In your own reduction, when dislocated internally, the patient should be tilted back onto their left side. Then place the ligaments on the junction of the thigh where they are located between the knee and the area that leads to swelling; then extend the ligament from the side opposite the swelling towards the other partition of the sternum.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another should firmly take hold of the patient's arms. Tighten up on the large area of the thigh, and extend the parts outward with strong extension until that returns to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this kind is of lighter treatment compared to other types, in which this member is reduced.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	And if you are excused from following this method of treatment for all these kinds, then you should have the two feet of the patient lying at the same time on a strong ligament, gently and firmly, on both heels and both ankles.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And the length of each is by quantity of four inches. And the thigh extends more than the other by a quantity of two inches.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And so the patient should be suspended from the head of the spine, and in their right hand. And the length of the earth's part is the quantity of two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And so command a strong youth to pinch the top of the thigh, and have them suspended by another youth's thigh, and the other youth to pinch the thing with such force that it returns at speed to its place.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	And in your own reduction, when dislocation is external at the hip part, have the thigh push against the ground as we instructed during our yellow treatment. And strengthen the ligament over the outer thigh precisely and over its foot.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And place two poles, one under the foot of the patient and the other on the head; and adjust two poles in the middle of the knee placed with wet cloths wrapped around them, so that the thigh of the patient is not dampened because the pole is between their thighs. And when you extend the parts, you mustn't pull it too much.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And each should extend to their part, and the doctor with his hand completes the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Then, if you adhere to this reversal, it will greatly be good; and otherwise, pause on that diligently and similarly as we said during our yellow treatment for that equality.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	And have the thigh lie on their sides quietly.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is at the front parts, then have the intestine extended slightly, and as per this method described on the knee; and the doctor places the palm of his right hand on the protruding thigh, and has him push against that with his other hand, and through that pressure he pauses while extending it to the front parts towards the area where the dislocation occurred.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is at the back parts, then it should not have the thigh extended to the front parts, but be lifted above the ground. Having said that, place it on a hard cause as when you would do when lying down if its width has been dislocated outward, according to what we said about the position of your body between two widths; and both their faces and their ligaments should be extended as we have stated, almost without error.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And ensure that a compress is placed on the area where there is pain in the joint.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	And once the reduction is completed according to this, if - and you are sure that there is no sign of the reduction in your view, then extend the patient's legs. And when you make these movements equal, and the patient bends their body so that it extends its leg and expands their excuse, then you know which part of the body, once reduced, has been returned - and then you adjust the thighs and apply a poultice and stretch them as much as possible on this side; and keep the patient at rest for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	Then loosen the ligament and poultice, and compare one leg against the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	And when you see these movements in the bed, then you know that the dislocation is already healed, and hence allow the patient to move.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any sign of softening, then you return and plaster that area, and stretch it according to your first correction, and let it rest for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Then loosen that area, and have the patient walk around on both feet for several days until they are comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter xxxii.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the treatment of dislocation of the shoulder.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The shoulder can be dislocated in three ways: it is dislocated to the outside of the joint, and inwardly towards the joint cavity, and further outwards than the latter. It is not dislocated from the front side.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of shoulder dislocation is when you command the patient to put their arm against their thigh; then you know that the shoulder has been dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all these ways is to make the patient lie down straight, as if they were extending their arm above them, if possible; attach your two hands to their face, and place their foot between your feet; then guide the shoulder into your palms, hold those between your fingers on the patient's shoulder with strength, and another serves to extend their foot until the shoulder returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of restoration is that their arm sticks to the thigh without causing any strain.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then plaster that area and have the arm stick to the thigh, then rest those parts on one side for three or four days, then loosen those areas.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not allow the patient to walk around for a few days, until they are healed and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	Perhaps if your reduction of the patient is justified, then administer strong extension to the ligaments as described in the previous narrative about the treatment of the hip.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter xxxiii.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the treatment of dislocation of the collarbone.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The collarbone can sometimes be caused by slight trauma, and at other times it is dislocated according to the completeness of the injury. The dislocation of the collarbone occurs either inside or outside the joint.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of collarbone dislocation is that you see the collarbone swollen proceeding to the part where it has been dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	Perhaps the treatment for the removal of this is a mild restoration, that it be extended with ease on the chest and made equal until it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	Perhaps in the treatment for when it is dislocated completely, you should make the patient lie straight, and have one servant hold that part strongly and bravely behind their arm on the middle of them.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	Then have your right hand under the patient's foot on the higher part of their body, and with your left hand on the lower part of the chest near the belly.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then pull the body towards you with your right hand, and with the left by two parts, and extend it on the left side; and push the feet of the chest to the right against their arm.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And make those movements in that way as we have discussed.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then push the feet towards the arm on the third part, and you are at the belly.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So if it returns in one or two movements as per this manner, and if you see the body equalized, it's good; but otherwise, then on the patient do the operation again, which is when it returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	Perhaps if you are prohibited from reducing the patient as we have recommended, then make the patient lie on their back on the ground, and hold a small pillow motionably on solid ground, and place that between their thighs, and already wrap a blanket around them so they don't move.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And the attendant should have their hands on their thighs, and another servant extends their foot against the extension of their side or onto the ligament that lies over the chest; and each person should extend themselves against the extension of their own partner, and the pillow stays between the patient's thighs holding them, so their body is not pulled towards the outer parts opposite their extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And the doctor equalizes the dislocation on their own side, and another attendant holds the healthy thigh in the outer parts, where the dislocation returns easily.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And when the dislocation returns and you declare the health of the reduction in your view, then rest with plastering and stretch that vigorously on the ligaments, and join the foot to the arm.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And when you fear or protect yourself from the nerves that are behind on the leg, to ensure that the ligament over there is not overly strong and does not hurt it heavily.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And let that rest for two or three days; if the ligament has softened, stretch it out.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And on the third day or fourth, gently untie that area, and prohibit the patient from walking for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	Mayhaps if it is forced to go before that space, without safety the dislocation might not dissolve and become rotten, and so that nothing receives treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if it happens that there is an abscess, then consider what we described in the conclusion of this narrative, elsewhere in the area of healing and dressing, until it is well treated.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter XXXIV.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On treatment for dislocation of the feet' fingers.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	When that which is dislocated has been extended slightly for six sessions; and what is not difficult, before it becomes easier.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	Perhaps if the dislocation is in some toes of both feet, then consider that you make the patient stand on a level surface or on a table, and remain like they would walk.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then stand on your feet, place your hand under where you are pressing the joints, and gently press it onto your foot with strength until it returns, and see that it is already evened out and does not appear in the pressed area.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then place the patient's foot on a table that supports all of their foot, with two points, and strengthen it with a strong and sturdy structure for three days; and then gently untie it and allow rest from walking for several days, until it is strengthened and its functionality can be assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	On the types of dislocation that occur from injury or fracture, or at any time.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any cause of those happens, and you fail in the treatment of that or in restoring them, deaths result from these.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And do not presume over the treatment of them yourself, but rather someone who is skilled in the art, long experienced, merciful and compassionate, not hasty, without zeal or presumptuous; they should use only those medicines that help to subdue abscesses, allowing the patient to remain under divine judgement, not towards themselves seeking salvation from loss, with alleviation of their illness in which you have some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then make every effort to promptly reduce them during the onset of the cause before an abscess appears.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then, if the limb returns as we wish, then administer a regimen that helps with abscess dressing and treats injuries using what you judge suitable from desiccated ointments.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if dislocation occurs from a fracture and there is separation of the bones, then you make the bones straight, and proceed as we have said in the simple injuries on this topic, where it was preceded by the locations of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And observe and avoid according to your virtue that of the medicine in the ways of fear as it has preceded my teaching; for what is better to you you should do to your Creator, more permanent to your glory, and more healing to your body when you see those things in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	So ends the words of Al-Buqais, perfectly from which God may be praised.
Amen.	Amen.
